title: Riot should bring back the reform system.
body:
I know this may be just an opinion, but I know quite a few people that agree with me. Back in around season two Riot had a system for people that got permanently banned, they could go through a system that would almost 80 % of the time work to reform the player and they would never get a ban again, I for one have got such things and think if I were to ever be permanently banned with how much time and money I have invested into this game, would be absolutely depressed over it. I think that it would be much better to have something like that, because Riot Games is the only (Trash) company to permanently ban people over things that aren't; hacking. Hope everyone agrees with me on this, Thanks!
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}} {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

So... you're told that it didn't work, you were even told to what massive degree it failed to work, and you reply is to refuse to accept that? Anecdotal evidence such as yours, even assuming you're telling the truth is next to worthless given the tiny sample pool you're working with. Riot has access to the full picture and you were told exactly how useless the experiment turned out to be. 

People who get banned have to go through, in general, several different punishment tiers to ever get to perma ban status. Unless you're the type to send out death treaths, or use awful hate speech, you won't be banned with warning. And if you do any of those, you -deserve it-.

Read the statistic posts Riot has posted many times before. Only a tiny fraction of the playerbase are hit with a chat restriction, and most of those are never hit again. A fraction of the people go on to be hit by another chat restriction, and only a fraction of those hit the 14 day ban. If people like that haven't reformed by then, they're not going to reform at all. That's the point of a permanent ban. They -have- been given a second chance. More than one. They ignored it. It's on them. We're all responsible for our own behavior, and actions have consequences. Yes, it'd suck to lose something you've spent time and money on, but you need to realize that you the only one to blame for the situation is you. Instead of bitching at Riot or calling them liars, instead have a proper look at yourself. Learn from the experience. Take the lost account as the price you had to pay to learn a valuable life lesson. Make something good come out of the shitty situation you put yourself in. 

And this isn't targetted at just you, but for the many, many people who've made claims of 'no really, I'll do better this time if you just give me one more chance' after getting banned. 

As for Riot's ban system, if you'd read their posts or knew a little bit about networking, you'd know why IP bans are next to worthless, and comes with the risk of hitting innocent players.
